meanings.definition: A map in which some thematic mapping variable is substituted for land area or distance.
meanings.sent1: The cartogram showed population density by changing the size of each country.
meanings.sent2: I studied a cartogram in geography class to understand how different variables are represented.
meanings.sent3: The cartogram decided to shrink some countries and enlarge others, just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cartogram, with thoughts expanding and contracting like changing land areas.
meanings.sent5: The cartogram made the data visually striking, making it easier to interpret.

meanings.definition: To represent (an area) on a cartogram.
meanings.sent1: She had to cartogram the city to show the distribution of resources.
meanings.sent2: The cartographer decided to cartogram the region to highlight the changes over time.
meanings.sent3: He cartogrammed the neighborhood, turning streets into abstract shapes on the map.
meanings.sent4: The artist cartogrammed the landscape, creating a unique and distorted representation.
meanings.sent5: Cartogramming the data helped visualize the patterns in a new and innovative way.
